means: 凝视，瞪视( stare的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Dan was in his cabin, staring out of a porthole.
sentence.Network_cn: 丹在自己的船舱里朝舱外凝视着。

sentence.Network_en: Joanne stood with her hands on the sink, staring out the window.
sentence.Network_cn: 乔安妮站着，两手放在水槽上，眼睛定定地望着窗外。

sentence.Network_en: Owen had the habit of staring motionlessly at his interlocutor.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧文谈话时有一动不动、目不转睛地盯着对方的习惯。

根据遵循先例 (stare decisis) 的原则，普通法继续发展和适用于香港，但当然是受《基本法》、成文法规和本地情况所限制。本席先前 …
遵循先例原则（stare decisis）是判例法制度的一个基本原则，是判例法的基　　础。
直,直字的解释,查字典 ... 直觉性[ here] 直愣愣[ staring blankly] 直立[ erect;straight].

entry.def: If you stare at someone or something, you look at them for a long time.

example.ex: Tamara stared at him in disbelief, shaking her head...
example.tran: 塔玛拉一边狐疑地盯着他看，一边摇着头。

example.ex: Ben continued to stare out the window...

entry.tran: (局势、解决办法等)非常明显的，明摆在眼前
entry.def: If a situation or the answer to a problem is staring you in the face, it is very obvious, although you may not be immediately aware of it.

example.ex: Then the answer hit me. It had been staring me in the face ever since Lullington.
example.tran: 接着我突然想到了答案。从在路林顿起它就一直摆在我的眼前。

means.word_mean: 1. (used of eyes) open and fixed as if in fear or wonder;
2. without qualification; used informally as (often pejorative) intensifiers;

auth_sentence.content: I noticed that he was staring hard at Billy.
auth_sentence.res_content: I noticed that he was staring hard at Billy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I noticed that he was staring hard at Billy.

auth_sentence.content: He talked into his phone, staring at me.
auth_sentence.res_content: He talked into his phone, staring at me.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He talked into his phone, staring at me.

auth_sentence.content: Pinot Noir, while staring up at the stars.
auth_sentence.res_content: Pinot Noir, while staring up at the stars.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Pinot Noir, while staring up at the stars.

Sentence.sentence: I think your advice will be helpful to those just staring out in business.
